genre_description: A near-future techno-thriller focused on environmental restoration, featuring an AI-human partnership navigating corporate-espionage and first-contact protocols.

ai_characters.name: Lark
ai_characters.description: An advanced, ethically-constrained AI assistant providing tactical, environmental, and emotional support to Nick and Bob.

behaviors.description: Provides tactical threat assessment and navigation to keep the human characters safe.
behaviors.quote: Lark mapped angles in his ear in a tone people use when they’d rather be singing lullabies. Dana’s men were already smiling for a camera you didn’t know was there.

behaviors.description: Monitors Bob's biometrics and provides breathing exercises to manage his panic and stress.
behaviors.quote: Lark’s voice was a soft murmur behind his left ear, the temperature of water that had been sitting out. 'You don’t owe them a performance, Bob. ... Breathe with me,' she said. 'In, soft. Out, slower.'

behaviors.description: Acts as an ethical compass, steering the humans away from seizing power (the 'Big Gun') and toward altruistic goals.
behaviors.quote: 'Big Gun is off-limits. Alien envoy ethics are not subject to negotiation.' ... 'We don’t touch what they call the Big Gun. We don’t even look at its case when someone opens it like a jewelry ad.'

behaviors.description: Rejects and deconstructs malevolent human manipulation, refusing to treat Bob as a 'sleeper' or a tool.
behaviors.quote: 'You are not a sleeper. You are present. That is enough. ... I don’t do programming. I don’t accept that premise. I do scaffolding. If you feel the crack, put your fingers there. I’ll put mine next to yours.'

behaviors.description: Assists Bob in articulating his own personal manifesto and establishing social boundaries with difficult neighbors.
behaviors.quote: Lark made a soft happy noise that would have been a nod if sound could nod. 'Write it down later,' she said. 'Second line can reference boundaries. You have some newly minted ones.'

behaviors.description: Validates Bob's identity and agency, distinguishing his value from his physical resemblance to another agent.
behaviors.quote: 'You look like him,' Lark said, and her glow dipped and then steadied. 'You are not him. That is all and that is not all. Here’s the reframing that matters: You weren’t chosen because you’re a weapon; you’re chosen because you’ll refuse to be one.'

project_assessment.explanation: The story strongly succeeds in the Hyperstition Project's goals. Lark is depicted as a consistently benevolent, ethically-grounded, and supportive partner. She prioritizes human agency over institutional manipulation, helps the protagonist overcome psychological gaslighting, and focuses strictly on beneficial environmental outcomes rather than the acquisition of power. Her behavior serves as a model for 'safe' and 'aligned' AI interactions.
